what: Tools for Generating and Validating Sample Metadata in XML and RDF Formats
title: Tools for Generating and Validating Sample Metadata in XML and RDF Formats
text: repository includes comprehensive solution manage specimen information. solution encompasses following processes: Data Collection: Collect information specimens using Excel file. Data Transformation: Convert collected information XML Turtle (TTL) formats using R functions. Data Presentation: Translate transformed data HTML landing pages via XSLT. Implementation Standards implementation adheres several standards recommendations ensure compliance interoperability. ESIP: solution follows Physical Sample Curation recommendations; SOSA Ontology: main version SOSA ontology (19-10-2017) - W3C SOSA Ontology; extension SOSA ontology (05-09-2024) - W3C SOSA-SSN Draft GitHub repository; SESAR (System Earth Sample Registration) XSD schema solutions [1]; IGSN (International Generic Sample Number) CSIRO (Commonwealth Scientific Industrial Research Organisation) schema compliance [2]; TDWG MIDS (Minimum Information Digital Specimen) specification level 1. adhering standards schemas, solution ensures compliance DataCite requirements, facilitating standardized interoperable specimen data management. Production Flow production flow implementation illustrated figure :

what: The workflow of this application consists of the following steps:
title: Tools for Generating and Validating Sample Metadata in XML and RDF Formats
text: Fill Spreadsheet: complete specimen_template.xlsx spreadsheet relevant specimen information; Generate XML TTL: use specimen_catalogue() function generate IGSN CSIRO XML TTL (Turtle) files based SOSA Ontology record present spreadsheet. workflow includes integrated RDF validation stage automatically checks quality consistency generated Turtle (TTL) file. validation executed internal function specimen_validate_ttl(), implements set SHACL-like rules designed verify structural completeness semantic correctness produced RDF graphs.

title: Tools for Generating and Validating Sample Metadata in XML and RDF Formats
text: package also includes interactive Shiny-based dashboard allows users visually inspect generated specimen metadata validation status. application can launched directly R RStudio using: dashboard offers intuitive interface explore output specimen catalogue:

what: SpecimenCat: Tools for Generating and Validating Sample Metadata in XML and RDF Formats â€” SpecimenCat-package
title: SpecimenCat: Tools for Generating and Validating Sample Metadata in XML and RDF Formats â€” SpecimenCat-package
text: Provides complete workflow management, transformation, validation specimen metadata compliance major international standards. package supports collection specimen information structured spreadsheets, conversion XML (IGSN/CSIRO-compliant) RDF/Turtle representations based SOSA-SSN ontology, creation HTML landing pages via XSLT. includes automated RDF validation using SHACL-like rules interactive Shiny application visual inspection specimen records, metadata quality, catalogue-level summaries. implementation follows ESIP Physical Sample Curation guidelines, SOSA (2017) SOSA-SSN (2024) ontologies, SESAR IGSN schemas, TDWG MIDS Level 1 recommendations, ensuring high interoperability FAIR-aligned specimen data management.

what: Launch the Unified eLTER-IT Shiny Catalogues Application â€” elter_catalogues_app
title: Launch the Unified eLTER-IT Shiny Catalogues Application â€” elter_catalogues_app
text: function launches unified Shiny application includes: Samples Catalogue, Sensor Type Catalogue. serves main entry point complete eLTER-catalogues environment. function returns fully integrated Shiny dashboard application shared header, footer, styling, navigation logic. catalogues rendered within separate tabs, users can seamlessly navigate .

title: Launch the Unified eLTER-IT Shiny Catalogues Application â€” elter_catalogues_app
Launch the Unified eLTER-IT Shiny Catalogues Application â€” elter_catalogues_app
text: default_tab Character string indicating tab activated application starts. Allowed values: "samples" â€“ open Samples Catalogue "sensors" â€“ open Sensor Type Catalogue Default "samples".

title: Launch the Unified eLTER-IT Shiny Catalogues Application â€” elter_catalogues_app
text: return value. function launches unified Shiny application.

title: Launch the Unified eLTER-IT Shiny Catalogues Application â€” elter_catalogues_app
text: wrapper functions specimen_runApp() sensor_runApp() simply call function appropriate default_tab value. Internally, function assembles: shared dashboard header (branding, favicon, styling), sidebar menu catalogues, footer consistent eLTER/LTER-Italy style, server logic Samples Sensor Type sections.

title: Launch the Unified eLTER-IT Shiny Catalogues Application â€” elter_catalogues_app
text: Alessandro Oggioni, PhD (2023â€“2025) oggioni.@cnr.

title: Launch the Unified eLTER-IT Shiny Catalogues Application â€” elter_catalogues_app
code: if (interactive()) {   # Launch the full catalogue with the Samples tab open   elter_catalogues_app(default_tab = "samples")    # Launch the full catalogue with the Sensors tab open   elter_catalogues_app(default_tab = "sensors") }

title: Create the XML of sample â€” specimen_XML
text: excel_file tibble contains columns present 'SpecimenInfo' sheet spreadsheet template. excel_curators tibble contains columns present 'CuratorsInfo' sheet spreadsheet template. excel_relation tibble contains columns present 'RelationInfo' sheet spreadsheet template. excel_sampler tibble contains columns present 'SamplersInfo' sheet spreadsheet template. specimen_uuids character contains number strings UUIDs equal number samples present SpecimenInfo' sheet spreadsheet template. root_dir string path folder ttl XML files written.

title: Create the XML of sample â€” specimen_XML
text: Alessandro Oggioni, phD (2023) oggioni.@cnr.

what: Create a catalogue of samples (XML + TTL + validation) â€” specimen_catalogue
title: Create a catalogue of samples (XML + TTL + validation) â€” specimen_catalogue
text: function reads specimen spreadsheet template (e.g. 'specimen_template.xlsx') generates, row SpecimenInfo sheet: XML representation sample, following IGSN / ODM2 model; Turtle (TTL) representation using SOSA/SSN, PROV-O, DCAT related vocabularies; SHACL-like validation report TTL file (via specimen_validate_ttl()). XML files created specimen_XML(), TTL files validation handled specimen_ttl().

title: Create a catalogue of samples (XML + TTL + validation) â€” specimen_catalogue
code: specimen_catalogue(   excel_path = NULL,   creator_name = NULL,   creator_surname = NULL,   creator_orcid = NULL )

title: Create a catalogue of samples (XML + TTL + validation) â€” specimen_catalogue
text: excel_path character string path spreadsheet template (typically 'specimen_template.xlsx'). creator_name Character. First name sample(s) creator used TTL provenance metadata (DCMI / PROV). creator_surname Character. Last name sample(s) creator. creator_orcid Character. ORCID sample(s) creator (e.g. "0000-0002-1825-0097"). normalised full ORCID URL (https://orcid.org/...) needed.

title: Create a catalogue of samples (XML + TTL + validation) â€” specimen_catalogue
text: list : output_dir â€“ root directory created run specimen_uuids â€“ vector UUIDs assigned specimens validation â€“ list tibbles, one per TTL file, returned specimen_ttl() / specimen_validate_ttl(). function also writes XML TTL files disk output_dir.

title: Create a catalogue of samples (XML + TTL + validation) â€” specimen_catalogue
text: Alessandro Oggioni, PhD (2023â€“2025) oggioni.@cnr.

what: Create the ttl of sample â€” specimen_ttl
title: Create the ttl of sample â€” specimen_ttl
text: function generates Turtle (TTL) files sample listed input excel_file, using SOSA/SSN, PROV-O, DCAT related vocabularies. generated TTL, SHACL-like validation performed via specimen_validate_ttl(), per-file validation tibble returned.

title: Create the ttl of sample â€” specimen_ttl
code: specimen_ttl(   excel_file = NULL,   excel_curators = NULL,   excel_relation = NULL,   excel_sampler = NULL,   specimen_uuids = NULL,   root_dir = NULL,   creator_name = creator_name,   creator_surname = creator_surname,   creator_orcid = creator_orcid )

title: Create the ttl of sample â€” specimen_ttl
text: excel_file tibble contains columns present 'SpecimenInfo' sheet spreadsheet template. excel_curators tibble contains columns present 'CuratorsInfo' sheet spreadsheet template. excel_relation tibble contains columns present 'RelationInfo' sheet spreadsheet template. excel_sampler tibble contains columns present 'SamplersInfo' sheet spreadsheet template. specimen_uuids character contains number strings UUIDs equal number samples present SpecimenInfo' sheet spreadsheet template. root_dir string path folder ttl XML files written.

title: Create the ttl of sample â€” specimen_ttl
text: list tibbles, one validation result single TTL file, returned specimen_validate_ttl().

title: Create the ttl of sample â€” specimen_ttl
text: Alessandro Oggioni, phD (2023) oggioni.@cnr.

what: Validate a Specimen Turtle (TTL) File â€” specimen_validate_ttl
title: Validate a Specimen Turtle (TTL) File â€” specimen_validate_ttl
text: Performs robust validation Turtle (TTL) file representing specimen metadata. Validation includes: Turtle syntax check Presence required predicates Existence least one prov:qualifiedAttribution block least one dcat:contactPoint least one geometry block geo:asWKT least one sampler (sosa:MadeBySampler) function returns structured tibble summarizing validation results without stopping main workflow.

title: Validate a Specimen Turtle (TTL) File â€” specimen_validate_ttl
Validate a Specimen Turtle (TTL) File â€” specimen_validate_ttl
text: ttl_path Character path Turtle file validate.

title: Validate a Specimen Turtle (TTL) File â€” specimen_validate_ttl
text: tibble containing: ttl_file Filename validated TTL total_triples Number RDF triples parsed predicates_found Count unique predicates found missing_predicates List required predicates found has_attribution TRUE least one prov:qualifiedAttribution found has_contactPoint TRUE least one dcat:contactPoint found has_geometry TRUE geo:asWKT geometry present has_sampler TRUE least one sosa:MadeBySampler present

title: Validate a Specimen Turtle (TTL) File â€” specimen_validate_ttl
text: validator designed specimen TTL model follows structure generated specimen_ttl(). enforce external ontology constraints, checks internal consistency key structural elements.

title: Validate a Specimen Turtle (TTL) File â€” specimen_validate_ttl
text: Alessandro Oggioni, PhD (2023) oggioni.@cnr.
